qas.question: How many museums are in Oklahoma?
How does Oklahoma's per-capita arts spending rank?
What kind of museum is the Philbrook?
Where are Thomas Gilcrease's collections housed?

context: Oklahoma is in the nation's middle percentile in per capita spending on the arts, ranking <a1_0>17th<a1_0/>, and contains <a0_0>more than 300<a0_0/> museums. The Philbrook Museum of <a2_0>Tulsa<a2_0/> is considered one of the top 50 <a3_0>fine art<a3_0/> museums in the United States, and the Sam Noble Oklahoma Museum of Natural History in Norman, one of the largest university-based art and history museums in the country, documents the natural history of the region. The collections of Thomas Gilcrease are housed in the <a4_0>Gilcrease Museum of Tulsa<a4_0/>, which also holds the world's largest, most comprehensive collection of art and artifacts of the American West.
